title: Effects of an inhibitor of glycolysis set member 1

content.description:
Certain chemicals, including sodium fluoride (<math alttext="N a F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), are capable of inhibiting specific steps of glycolysis. Figure 1 shows the steps of the glycolysis pathway, indicating where various macromolecules enter the pathway as well as the specific reaction inhibited by <math alttext="N a F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Figure 1. Key steps in the metabolic pathway of glucose
content.question: If <math alttext="N a F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is added to cells undergoing cellular respiration, which of the following will most likely accumulate in the cells?

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
